### LLVMGetMDNodeNumOperands() {#gad0cbd901b244574f123718c7a33c52c6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned LLVMGetMDNodeNumOperands (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> V)</>}>
Obtain the number of operands from an MDNode value.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="V">MDNode to get number of operands from.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
Number of operands of the MDNode.
</SectionUser>

### LLVMGetMDNodeOperands() {#gae42c7759c81bdd4fce63ac78d0fd42ed}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMGetMDNodeOperands (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> V, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> &#42; Dest)</>}>
Obtain the given MDNode&#39;s operands.

The passed <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> pointer should point to enough memory to hold all of the operands of the given MDNode (see LLVMGetMDNodeNumOperands) as LLVMValueRefs. This memory will be populated with the LLVMValueRefs of the MDNode&#39;s operands.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="V">MDNode to get the operands from.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Dest">Destination array for operands.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l03227">3227</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l01412">1412</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Obtain the underlying string from a MDString value.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="V">Instance to obtain string from.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Length">Memory address which will hold length of returned string.</ParametersListItem>

### LLVMMDStringInContext2() {#ga645a6ce741bdd4d657c8ce1ca457075c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMMetadataRef LLVMMDStringInContext2 (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga9c43e01525516ff6b4feab5166c5b1da">LLVMContextRef</a> C, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; Str, size&#95;t SLen)</>}>
Create an MDString value from a given string value.

The MDString value does not take ownership of the given string, it remains the responsibility of the caller to free it.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
